tokenvisibility.name: Alt. Token Visibility
tokenvisibility.settings.range-algorithm: Number of points to use when testing whether a token is within range of another.
tokenvisibility.settings.range-points-3d: When applicable, use token elevation and token height to construct additional points for testing range. (Requires Wall Height module.)
tokenvisibility.settings.range-distance-: Whether to measure token visibility range calculations in 3 dimensions, versus 2 (overhead view).
tokenvisibility.settings.los-algorithm.H: How to test a token's line-of-sight to another (target) token.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-percent.Hin: Percentage of the token hit area that must be viewable to another token to be considered visible by that other token. For points, this is the percentage of target points that must be visible. If set to 0, then if any part of the token (or any point) is viewable, it is considered visible.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-large-targe: If the target token is larger than the grid square, consider the token visible if at least one grid square worth of token is visible.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-points-view: How many points on the viewer to test for the viewer's line-of-sight. Beware that this can dramatically increase the number of tests needed to determine visibility. Foundry default is 'Center' (one point)
tokenvisibility.settings.los-inset-viewe: For viewer points other than the center, what percentage to inset the point from the token border towards the token center.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-points-targ: How many points on the target to test for the viewer's line-of-sight.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-inset-targe: For target points other than the center, what percentage to inset the point from the token border towards the token center.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-points-3d.H: Test the top and bottom of the target token in addition to the points in the middle of the token vertically.
tokenvisibility.settings.debug-range.Hin: If enabled, will draw representation on the canvas of the token vision range. Note that tokens still may be visible if illuminated but out of range.
tokenvisibility.settings.debug-los.Name: Debug LOS
tokenvisibility.settings.debug-los.Hint: If enabled, will draw representation on the canvas of the token vision line-of-sight. If Area3d is enabled, you must target a token to make the debug window appear.
Alt. Token Visibility settings changed to Foundry defaults
tokenvisibility.settings.button-dnd5e.No: Alt. Token Visibility settings changed to D&D 5e DMG defaults
tokenvisibility.settings.button-threeD.N: Alt. Token Visibility settings changed to 3D defaults
tokenvisibility.template.settings-config: How distance between the viewer token and the target token is measured.
The viewer is the token with the vision. These settings adjust how the viewer's line-of-sight is treated.
The target is the token being perceived. These settings adjust how the target shape is considered programatically.
tokenvisibility.settings.submenu.title: Alternative Token Visibility Settings
tokenvisibility.settings.submenu.Name: ATV Settings
tokenvisibility.settings.submenu.Label: Configure
